title: materialDefinition
description: The materialDefinition describes how a feature or a set of features is to be rendered. This includes which shading and which colors to use. The following table provides the set of attributes and params for the `type`: `standard` material.

name.description: A name for the material as assigned in the creating application.

type.description: Indicates the material type, chosen from the supported values {standard, water, billboard, leafcard, reference}.

$ref.description: JSONPointer - The href that resolves to the shared resource bundle in which the material definition is contained.

params.vertexRegions.description: Indicates whether this material uses per-vertex regions. Defaults to false.

params.vertexColors.description: Indicates whether this material use vertex colors. Defaults to false.

params.useVertexColorAlpha.description: Indicates whether vertex colors also contain a transparency channel. Defaults to false.

params.transparency.description: Indicates the transparency of the material; 0 = opaque, 1 = fully transparent.

params.renderMode.description: Rendering mode, any one of {textured, solid, untextured, wireframe}

params.castShadows.description: True if features with this material should cast shadows.

params.receiveShadows.description: True if features with this material should receive shadows.

params.cullFace.description: Indicates the material culling options {back, front, *none*}. Default being none.
